title: Sweet Potato, Kale and White Bean Soup
instructions:
1. In a large pot, heat the grapeseed oil over medium high and add the sweet potato. Saut the sweet potato, stirring consistently about 5 minutes before adding the onion. Saut about 8 minutes then add a splash of chicken broth to help steam the sweet potato and onion (the chicken broth should sizzle when it hits the pot). Continue cooking until sweet potato is softened but still al dente, another 5 minutes or so.
  2. Add all of the chicken broth, white wine, cannellini beans and the oregano and thyme. Stir well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer covered about 10 minutes. Add the chopped kale leaves, stir, cover again and cook another 5 minutes until kale leaves are softened. Taste the soup and add salt and ground black pepper to taste.

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 head red kale, stems removed, leaves chopped
extendedIngredients.name: kale

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium sweet potato, peel on, chopped into ½” cubes
extendedIngredients.name: sweet potato

extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup white wine (I used chardonnay)
extendedIngredients.name: white wine
